definition: to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]
afferent nerve (transmitting in to the brain)/afferent neuron

sentences.english: The little girl was fascinated by all the fish swimming in the aquarium tanks.
sentences.chinese: 小女孩被水族箱中所有魚的泳姿所吸引入神。

sentences.english: She found his story so compelling that she had forgotten to drink wine.
sentences.chinese: 他的故事使她聽得入神，以至她忘記喝酒了。

sentences.english: A three-year-old kid was so fascinated by the music that he forgot everything around.
sentences.chinese: 最捧場的是一位三歲小童，聽得入神。

sentences.english: Some primary afferent neurons were presented in the nodose ganglia.
sentences.chinese: 部分初級傳入神經元位於迷走神經結狀節內。

sentences.english: He was entranced by the painting.
sentences.chinese: 他看這幅畫兒都看得入神了。

sentences.english: She had her audience listening attentively .
He often talked deep into the night surrounded by us entranced in his story.
sentences.chinese: 每每講到深夜，同學們圍在他的身邊，聽得極其入神。

sentences.english: This is why the Lord Jesus told Nicodemus that he had to be born into the kingdom of God.
sentences.chinese: 這就是何以主耶穌對尼哥底母說，他必鬚生入神的國。

sentences.english: People all seated on the floor and drank in his words in deep silence.
sentences.chinese: 人們都坐在地板上，靜靜地入神地傾聽他的話語。

sentences.english: He listened to the music with ecstasy .
The Mole was bewitched, entranced, fascinated.
sentences.chinese: 鼴鼠如醉如癡，入神入迷。

sentences.english: He was enthralled by the exciting story.
sentences.chinese: 那激動人心的故事使他聽得入神了。

sentences.english: I remember the time when we staring at it, abstractly .
sentences.chinese: 我還記得我們入神地望着它的時間。

sentences.english: The children were all eyes as the clowns came into the ring.
sentences.chinese: 當小丑們走進場時，孩子們看得十分入神。

definition: with keen interest (idiom)/with great pleasure/with gusto/eagerly
unable to take one's eyes off (idiom); to gaze steadily/to stare
to concentrate one's attention completely (idiom)/with rapt attention
